resources

Class Vao

  • java.lang.Object
    • resources.Vao
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Resource

    public class Vao
extends java.lang.Object
implements Resource
    Object oriented wrapper class above the native Vertex Array Object. It can store an EBO and VBOs.

        @Bind
public boolean createVbo(java.lang.String name)
        Creates a new VBO. Each VBO's name must be unique.
        Parameters:
        name - VBO's name
        Returns:
        true if the VBO successfully created, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - name can't be null

      • bindAndAddData

        public void bindAndAddData(@NotNull
                           java.lang.String vboName,
                           int attributeNumber,
                           int coordinateSize,
                           @NotNull
                           float[] data,
                           boolean dynamic)
        Binds the specified VBO and stores the given data in it.
        Parameters:
        vboName - vbo's name
        attributeNumber - shader's attribute number
        coordinateSize - number of a vector's coordinates
        data - data
        dynamic - true if the data should be dynamic, false otherwise

      • bindAndAddData

        public void bindAndAddData(@NotNull
                           java.lang.String vboName,
                           int attributeNumber,
                           int coordinateSize,
                           @NotNull
                           java.nio.FloatBuffer data,
                           boolean dynamic)
        Binds the specified VBO and stores the given data in it.
        Parameters:
        vboName - vbo's name
        attributeNumber - shader's attribute number
        coordinateSize - number of a vector's coordinates
        data - data
        dynamic - true if the data should be dynamic, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - attribute number can't be lower than 0 and coordinate size must be in the (1;4) interval
        java.lang.NullPointerException - arguments can't be null

      • isUsable

        public boolean isUsable()
        Determines wheter this VAO is usable. If it returns false, you can't use it for anything.
        Specified by:
        isUsable in interface Resource
        Returns:
        true if usable, false otherwise

      • release

        public void release()
        Removes the VBOs, the EBO and the VAO from the VRAM. After you released the VAO, you can't use it for anything.
        Specified by:
        release in interface Resource
